TopicTitle: You Will Not Go To Space Today - Post your fails here!

Articles.Content:
So, I started up a Duna mission, the Hyperion I. She was a damn fine craft, named 'Most beautiful Ship in the Kerbal Fleet' by several high-class engineers. Here she is in Kerbin Orbit preparing to depart.
She possesses an Ike Lander, Anubis (Tucked away in the middle), her primary lander; Hyperion, an orbital segment, and a return capsule.
Here she is in Kerbin Orbit

The plan was to leave the Anubis and the Hyperion Lander in Duna to save Delta-V. She was assembled in Orbit. which lead to some issues in the Delta V calculation done in the VAB.
Here she is departing Kerbin

Sadly, she had not enough Delta V to capture herself, and the fuel in her landers was spent in a last ditch effort to avoid interplanetary space, this (Somehow) works. This leaves a crew of 5 Kerbals in Orbit of Duna. The crew considered ditching the Hyperion Lander, but simulations showed it would fall towards the craft, crippling the remainder of it.

Now, this is when the engineers realized something horrible. To rescue the crew of high-profile Kerbal Astronauts, they would need a docking port. Hyperion had no spare docking ports. Several lead engineers wanted to do a quick switch between the lander and the refueler, but this was deemed too dangerous due to the incompetence of the agency at docking multiple times in a short period of time. a 'Klaw' was tested prior to the mission, capturing the asteroid Pandora. but this had not been tested on rocket parts. Eventually, the Hyperion I was deemed the biggest failure in the space program, and its crew would be rescued by the Hyperion II follow-up mission, which abandoned landing as a whole and left the Hyperion I a wreck in Duna orbit. Not even usable as a comms array due to the heavy budget cuts in its construction.

Got to space this morning , but I don't think my Duna lander is going to survive the trip to the surface.

Someone forgot the heat shield.

On 1.5.2017 at 9:23 PM, linuxgurugamer said:

So last night I'm streaming. Everything going well, current contract is to do an orbital rendezvous.  Jeb took off and orbited at 100km.  Now it was Carl's turn.

Identical rocket

3, 2, 1, launch.

Oops.  Hit space bar two times due to lag. Boosters take off, main rocket settles back to the pad

 

Beautiful....

And your reaction is priceless!

/lift chapeau 

Funny Kabooms 

Urses

On 5/22/2017 at 3:20 AM, egoego said:

Good Heavens, are you sure you used enough Girders?

Just imagine if ol' Whack'd had access to the even lighter and more questionable empty .75m liquid fuel tank when he was starting out.  'Best mass per unit length of any part, once you drain the fuel.

Oh bloody Kraken.

The Nomad Mk III Colony Ship -- having a significant increase and restructuring of mass over the Mk II -- takes a short orbital test flight.

Mission Control seems to have forgotten to inform the crew it was an meant to be an unmanned test flight. Probably not a problem.

Engineering reports that SOMEONE seems to have still not gotten around to adding chutes to anything other than the escape pods. Little late, now, but telemetry looks great!

Probably not a problem.

Full engine shutdown -- stable orbit achieved! Put the crew in for commendations for successful launch of a 2000+ ton vessel!

Break out the champagne and let's warp this big beautiful lady into sunrise for some pic--Control! We're reading a shimmy! Slash! Slash! Slash! Break warp!

AAAAAAUOOOOOOGAAAH! AAAAAAAUOOOOOGAH!

KRAKEN STRIKE! I REPEAT! KRAKEN STRIKE!! BROKEN ARROW!

Good news! Escape pods are intact!

Bad news! They're getting away!

Jeb, Bob, and Bill make it over okay...

Val...

Val misses.

The horror. The horror!!

Shake it off, Mission Control! We have other Kerbals to save. Her clone will be back in action before you know it.

Danline and Ening don't have any supplies in that Orca module...the debris segment that the other three EVA'd to has all the escape pods, supplies, and cryo tubes. Need to get a rescue mission up there ASAP.

Meanwhile, get Jeb, Bob, and Bill back on the ground. Deploy the escape pods:

Hasty redesign of the same escape pods yields the Roswell Mk II Automated Rescue Pod. We get her into orbit...tomorrow, we save the remaining crew:

 

 

And will somebody update the playlist in the clone decanting bay?! The last Val, while sorely missed, had terrible taste in music...

 

-Jn-

 

Edited May 26, 2017 by JoeNapalm

my fail today:

while i was removing old escape ship i found too late that my base has alot of solar panels and i entangled myself into them and i had troubles geting out of my problem luckly i was able to save the ship and all solar panels

Roswell VI has a slight hiccup during the ascent profile on the mission to Minmus:

Amazingly, the ABORT action group saved the capsule -- Jeb and Bill survived, and on the next attempt successfuly planted a flag on Minmus and got to faff about a bit before noticing that, having landed on the dark side with no RTGs, the batteries were getting awfully low (thaaaank you indicator lights mod!) and had to come home.

 

-Jn-

Edited June 8, 2017 by Vinhero100

so i'm trying to make a gliding bike. i don't know why, but i am. anyway, I've been having endless trouble with it, such as the bike not having enough lift after the sepratron ran out of fuel, and plummeting like a rock, to putting on too many reaction wheels on and one roll command sending it flying. still, the idea of having a bicycle that glides with rocket power is too good for Jeb to leave all the glory to GTA V.

As a matter of fact, my rocket did not need more struts, boosters, or parachutes.

As a matter of fact, my rocket did need more sepatrons on the boosters.
